InVision

I started work on this in September 2010. Although 2.5 years has passed, the outcome is relatively close to the original idea. I've documented the changes below. I enjoy reading the details so I've documented the progression quite extensively.

I couldn't find what I wanted in the themes section so I thought I'd have a go at making my own. The idea was to release it as a free theme once it's been built and properly tested.

Hangin puncutation wasn't a big thing in 2010 and I honestly don't recall a single template on ant publishing platform that used it. Fast-forward to 2015 and it's more common — the biggest one being on Medium.

  1. Post Office desktop/mobile layout

Georgia Pro

After sampling a near hundred webfonts, I settled on this. Its generous x-height means it performs well at the small sizes (copyright, captions, etc). It's a very stable, sober looking face, without being too stiff.
